title: Login
content:
Just wondering, and I though I should ask now, or I may never remember to, does anyone else have to login to EZBoard every day? It seems that if I leave the board for more than about 15 minutes, I have to login again. Is this normal? Does EZB have any means of insuring that I login automatically, like on Keen:Modding?

(Also, something totally random here, is 'modding' a word? Should it have 2 ds?)[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

title: Re: Login
content:
Modding is a word because it's used, whatever it's official or not is not important. I suppose that the second 'd' was added because of the allegory.

About your second question: Ezboard is indeed a pain in the ass (no pun intended!) if it comes to this. It might also be due to your firewall or cookie settings but probably not.

Worry not though, we are going to move really really soon.
Right guys?

title: Re: Login
content:
If it's time based then it's definitely because of cookies. When a website sets a cookie it also sets a timeout, so for some reason your cookies must be timing out faster than everyone else's. Maybe you've got some "security" program that wipes your cookies every few hours? Who knows.

And sorry I did mean marking a forum read. I tend to think of this whole place as a single forum, with a handful of topics and a ton of posts under each topic. Not sure where I get that idea from, but I guess I find it funny to have a forum within a forum, given the definition of the term.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]
